column4: Can anyone tell me why when I try to burn 4.5gb of stuff onto a dvd that is supposedly 4.7gb in capacity I am told to ejectr the dick and insert one with 4.5gb capacity or more?
is the media detected properly in the program?
I don't know, how do I find out?
try brasero? there is probably some way in nautilus, i just dont know how
okay... I've had this problem in previous versions of Ubuntu too.
could be flaky drive or media, some writeable disk formats are preferred to others
when I try to use brasero I get this error when I hit burn: the file (null) couldn't be read (Bad address).
in image burning setup, right before you burn it, click the properties button for the selected media
what does it say, does it properly detect the media?
as far as I can tell... the title of the window is Properties of DVD-RAM UJ-852S
what format is the image file? try with a different drive or different image file
in the main window it shows the folder that I want to burn to disk under the files menu and next to the burn button it has a bar that shows 3.3/4.3GiB so I assume that means there is enough room
I don't see a way to alter the type of image?
oh ok so you are doing a data project right?
That's what I'm aiming for... I have a folder with a tonne of e-books and I want to burn them
